name: Mukkam Muslim Orphanage Committee
briefDescription: Mukkam Muslim Orphanage was established in 1956 admitting 22 orphans. It has now taken a shape of university where about 7000 students are pursuing their education. Among 7000 students more than 1000 students are orphans and poor children who are provided food, clothes, accommodation, education, medical treatment and study material at free of cost. Recognizing the efficiency of the quality education with complete care to the orphans, the government of India conferred Mukkam Muslim Orphanage two national awards one in 1982 by Dr Giani Zail Sing and the other in 2008 by Mrs Sonia Gandhi.
